snippet: Today's parade in Manhattan celebrating the New York Giants's Superbowl win has touched off anger and unease among some returned Iraq veterans, who are eagerly awaiting their own recognition.
abstract: Today's parade in Manhattan celebrating the New York Giants's Superbowl win has touched off anger and unease among some returned Iraq veterans, who are eagerly awaiting their own recognition.
lead_paragraph: On Broadway in Manhattan this morning you could not miss them -- a big blue surge of spectators lining the streets. Thousands of fans turned out to see the New York Giants, fresh from a Superbowl win on Sunday, march victoriously through the Canyon of Heroes in Lower Manhattan. But as the players were feted with a ticker-tape parade, some Iraq veterans were asking: Why not us?

headline.main: Drumbeat Grows on Twitter for New York Parade for Veterans
